{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3543841,"name":"","username":"RoyalKnight","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/ce7236/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T22:41:25.752Z","cooked":"

Hey! I have set up the swerve drive post estimator and I have set up path planning on the fly with path planner lib.

The way I have to set up is the first waypoint is the swerve pose estimators current position and then the second is the point I want to go to. However it first goes to the “initial position” (the parameter in the constructor) of the swerve drive pose estimator instead of just staying at its current position and then going to the final waypoint.

Any help would be super appreciated!

174078241542944755585660754739341920×1080 106 KB

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2025-02-28T22:41:25.752Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":46,"reads":149,"readers_count":148,"score":259.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":493676,"topic_slug":"swerve-path-following-on-the-fly","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65426,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/swerve-path-following-on-the-fly/493676/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3543849,"name":"Val","username":"Otter502","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/otter502/{size}/245799_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-28T22:54:47.707Z","cooked":"

I think the issue is that the command is “generated” when the robot starts up!
this means that the “waypointFromPoses” is called when the robot starts up and gets stored. Then when you press the button pathplanner tries to go to the start of the path which is the initial position that is passed in to the pose Estimator.
This might not be the most effective solution but you could wrap the command in a Commands.defer(() → …, Set.of())
that way the command is generated when the button is pressed!
Also be careful with using the swerve drive’s pose as a waypoint since the rotation of the pose isn’t the starting rotation, instead it’s the direction of travel!

Here are the docs for it:

github.wpilib.org

DeferredCommand (WPILib API 2025.3.1)

declaration: package: edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command, class: DeferredCommand

So it would look something like this:

m_drivercontroller.a().whileTrue(
Commands.defer(()->
swerveSubsystem.gotoPath(
PathPlannerPath.waypointsFromPoses(
swerveSubsystem.SwerveDrivePoseEstimator.getEstimatedPosition(),
new Pose2d(3,3.891, Rotation2d.fromDegrees(0))))), swerveSubsystem):

I figured it out!! Although, any tips on the heading issue of it being relative to the direction of travel and not the field? Is there a better way to do this whole setup?

Yes! This is my favorite topic!
So to create the path i recommend having your initial direction of travel be the direction of motion of the server drive. This has the benefit of being incredibly smooth when the driving is in motion. It runs into issues if the target and initial are right on top of each other or if the drive is standing still (in which case you’ll have to use IF statements for exceptions)
We have some very messy code (and some cleaner untested code) that I can direct you towards if you want more clarification!

Sorry for the late reply, here is a link to the slightly messy align to reef command:

github.com

Spartronics4915/2025-Reefscape/blob/autos/src/main/java/com/spartronics4915/frc2025/commands/autos/AlignToReef.java

package com.spartronics4915.frc2025.commands.autos;

import static com.spartronics4915.frc2025.Constants.Drive.AutoConstants.kPathConstraints;
import static com.spartronics4915.frc2025.Constants.Drive.AutoConstants.kAlignmentAdjustmentTimeout;
import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.MetersPerSecond;
import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Seconds;

import java.util.ArrayList;
import java.util.Arrays;
import java.util.List;
import java.util.Set;

import com.pathplanner.lib.auto.AutoBuilder;
import com.pathplanner.lib.path.GoalEndState;
import com.pathplanner.lib.path.IdealStartingState;
import com.pathplanner.lib.path.PathPlannerPath;
import com.pathplanner.lib.path.Waypoint;
import com.spartronics4915.frc2025.RobotContainer;
import com.spartronics4915.frc2025.commands.VariableAutos.BranchSide;
import com.spartronics4915.frc2025.commands.VariableAutos.ReefSide;

the cleaner version is currently a branch I am currently working on and so it isn’t public just yet!
